result.execSummary:
The defendant Jazmine Rose Peterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $265.60 fine/costs to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.

$200.00 DNA surcharge to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.
Must complete an AODA assessment and comply with recommendations. Enroll within 60 days.

Absolute sobriety.

No drugs without a prescription and only in amount prescribed.

No drug paraphernalia.

Must complete any treatment or programming required by agent.

If accepted into the Butterfly House, must comply with all house rules.

Must provide a DNA sample.  Under Wisconsin Statute 165.76, you are required to provide a biological specimen to the Wisconsin Department of Justice for deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) testing.  If you fail to provide a DNA sample, you may be held in contempt and subject to sanctions or charged with a new crime.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jazmine Rose Peterson

records.addlTxt: DNA Submission Acknowledgment Form

10:54 AM Defendant Jazmine Rose Peterson in court, in custody.  Attorney Nicholas R White in court for Jazmine Rose Peterson. Prosecuting attorney Jeffrey Lawrence Kemp in court for the State of Wisconsin. RL-clerk. DA has filed amended information. On count 1- def- G plea. On count 2- def- G plea. CT accepts pleas, adj G. 

SENTENCE:
Count 1: W/held sent 2 years probation. 180 days banked jail for probation. Not subj to GT. 
Count 2: W/held sent 2 years probation. Probation conditions on both: AODA and comply. Must enroll within 60 days. AS. No drugs without a prescription. No drug para. Any treatment or programming required by agent. If accepted into Butterfly House, must comply with all house rules. $265.60 fine/costs on each count, $200 DNA surcharge on each count, DNA sample. 60 dtp or set up PP with COCC. 20 days credit if revoked. 11:12 am adj.
